title: The Wretched of the Earth
author: Frantz Fanon
review: Excellent text on settler societies and the effects that settler colonialism has on colonized peoples. Highly recommended for Marxists interested in gaining a better understanding of how colonialism should play into our ideology and revolutionary practice.

title: The State and Revolution
author: Vladimir Ilyich Lenin
review: Lenin brilliantly describes the role of the state in class society and how it can and must be wielded by the proletariat and its vanguard to suppress the bourgeoisie until class society has been abolished. A marxist classic.

title: Ender's Game
author: Orson Scott Card
review: It's fun I guess. idk i read it a long time ago
